metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28878 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, the Zip implementation calls __iterator_get_unchecked() more than once for the same index (under certain conditions) when next_back() and next() are used together. This bug could lead to a memory safety violation due to an unmet safety requirement for the TrustedRandomAccess trait.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.67 - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-all - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-clippy - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-gdb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-lldb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-src - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustc - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustfmt - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2').
